TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed beforefieldinit SystemColors extends System.Object

Docs.summary: Each property of the class is a structure that is the color of a Windows display element.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Better performance is achieved by using the properties of the <xref:System.Drawing.SystemPens> or <xref:System.Drawing.SystemBrushes> classes rather than creating a new pen or brush based on a value from <xref:System.Drawing.SystemColors>. For example, if you wanted to get a brush for the face color of a 3-D element, use the <xref:System.Drawing.SystemBrushes.Control%2A?displayProperty=nameWithType> property because it gets a brush that already exists, whereas calling the <xref:System.Drawing.SolidBrush.%23ctor%2A> constructor with a parameter value of <xref:System.Drawing.SystemColors.Control%2A?displayProperty=nameWithType> will create a new brush.
## Examples The following code example demonstrates the <xref:System.Drawing.Color.op_Equality%2A> operator and the <xref:System.Drawing.SystemColors> class. This example is designed to be used with a Windows Form that contains a button named `Button1`. Paste the following code into your form and associate the `Button1_Click` method with the button's `Click` event.
[!code-cpp[System.Drawing.CharacterRangeExample#2](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_Winforms/System.Drawing.CharacterRangeExample/CPP/form1.cpp#2)] [!code-csharp[System.Drawing.CharacterRangeExample#2](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Winforms/System.Drawing.CharacterRangeExample/CS/form1.cs#2)] [!code-vb[System.Drawing.CharacterRangeExample#2](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Winforms/System.Drawing.CharacterRangeExample/VB/form1.vb#2)]

MemberSignature.Value: Public Shared ReadOnly Property ActiveBorder As Color
public: static property System::Drawing::Color ActiveBorder { System::Drawing::Color get(); };

Docs.summary: Gets a structure that is the color of the active window's border.
Docs.value: A that is the color of the active window's border.

MemberSignature.Value: Public Shared ReadOnly Property ActiveCaption As Color
public: static property System::Drawing::Color ActiveCaption { System::Drawing::Color get(); };

Docs.summary: Gets a structure that is the color of the background of the active window's title bar.
Docs.value: A that is the color of the active window's title bar.

MemberSignature.Value: Public Shared ReadOnly Property ActiveCaptionText As Color
public: static property System::Drawing::Color ActiveCaptionText { System::Drawing::Color get(); };

Docs.summary: Gets a structure that is the color of the text in the active window's title bar.
Docs.value: A that is the color of the text in the active window's title bar.

MemberSignature.Value: Public Shared ReadOnly Property AppWorkspace As Color
public: static property System::Drawing::Color AppWorkspace { System::Drawing::Color get(); };

Docs.summary: Gets a structure that is the color of the application workspace.
Docs.value: A that is the color of the application workspace.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The application workspace is the area in a multiple-document view that is not being occupied by documents.

MemberSignature.Value: Public Shared ReadOnly Property ButtonFace As Color
public: static property System::Drawing::Color ButtonFace { System::Drawing::Color get(); };

Docs.summary: Gets a structure that is the face color of a 3-D element.
Docs.value: A that is the face color of a 3-D element.

MemberSignature.Value: Public Shared ReadOnly Property ButtonHighlight As Color
public: static property System::Drawing::Color ButtonHighlight { System::Drawing::Color get(); };

Docs.summary: Gets a structure that is the highlight color of a 3-D element.
Docs.value: A that is the highlight color of a 3-D element.

remarks.format: ## Remarks This color is applied to parts of a 3-D element that face the light source.

MemberSignature.Value: Public Shared ReadOnly Property ButtonShadow As Color
public: static property System::Drawing::Color ButtonShadow { System::Drawing::Color get(); };

Docs.summary: Gets a structure that is the shadow color of a 3-D element.
Docs.value: A that is the shadow color of a 3-D element.

remarks.format: ## Remarks This color is applied to parts of a 3-D element that face away from the light source.

public: static property System::Drawing::Color Control { System::Drawing::Color get(); };

remarks.format: ## Remarks Items in a list that are disabled are displayed in dimmed text.

MemberSignature.Value: Public Shared ReadOnly Property Highlight As Color
public: static property System::Drawing::Color Highlight { System::Drawing::Color get(); };

Docs.summary: Gets a structure that is the color of the background of selected items.
Docs.value: A that is the color of the background of selected items.

remarks.format: ## Remarks Selected items may include menu items as well as selected text. For example, the <xref:System.Drawing.Color> structure may be the color used for the background of selected items in a list box.

MemberSignature.Value: Public Shared ReadOnly Property HighlightText As Color
public: static property System::Drawing::Color HighlightText { System::Drawing::Color get(); };

Docs.summary: Gets a structure that is the color of the text of selected items.
Docs.value: A that is the color of the text of selected items.

remarks.format: ## Remarks For example, this color is used for the text of selected items in a list box.

MemberSignature.Value: Public Shared ReadOnly Property HotTrack As Color
public: static property System::Drawing::Color HotTrack { System::Drawing::Color get(); };

Docs.summary: Gets a structure that is the color used to designate a hot-tracked item.
Docs.value: A that is the color used to designate a hot-tracked item.

remarks.format: ## Remarks Single-clicking a hot-tracked item executes the item.
